attributes.action: stop the government from interfering with, or to repeal the 300 year old law that disallows catholics ascend to the UK throne
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
A motion put down by Scottish National Party MSP Mike Russell calls for the repeal of the discrimination enshrined in the Act of Settlement. That is the law which prevents a Catholic ascending the throne, and forbids the heir to the throne marrying a Catholic. 
This is part of the history of the UK and, as such, there is no reason for it to be interfered or otherwise meddled with.

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
